Reviews.Title: Avacom M1060 Wireless Pan & Tilt Camera with IR
Reviews.Author: DogMike "DogMike"
Reviews.Content: Prompt deliver, packaged correctly and works very well.  As a novice in installing security cameras it took a about an hour to get it to work.  It works very well and definitely recommend to all who want a security camera, snapshot, or video camera for day and night vision.  It works well to view anything you want in your house or anywhere indoors or viewing out a window or door.  The only thing I really had a problem with is understanding the technical terms like FTP and DDNS.  The manual on the CD that was provided takes you step by step to install the camera.  The price is very reasonable compared to other wireless cameras.  Very pleased with the purchase.  Would buy again.

Reviews.Title: It's not perfect but considering the cost this is a decent camera.
Reviews.Author: Dave
Reviews.Content: These are my initial thoughts after using the camera for a few days. I'll update this review if things change. This is my first IP camera.* Initial setup was fairly easy, although the instructions were junk. What you need to do: (1) plug camera into an ethernet port on your router / network switch. (2) plug camera into power (3) run the little initialization utility from Avacom's website from a computer on your network: www.avacomtech.com/support.html  (4) click "search" and the camera should show up in the list (5) select the camera from the list, enter the IP address you want it to use (or check 'set IP automatically' for DHCP) and then click "update"* After initial setup is done and the camera reboots, you can now use a browser on your network to view the camera directly. From there you can access additional settings like Network / Wireless, Alarm, Email (it can email you a series of screenshots on an alarm), Security / Users, and a bunch of other stuff.*  The wireless connection is a little flakey. It sometimes takes 10-15min before the camera connects itself to my wireless network. It will also sometimes disconnect itself for a while and come back later. Also, the wireless range is not very good and there is no strength indicator in the camera's interface. I have a very good to excellent signal with my laptop and phone in the same areas. One other thing with the wireless that's bothering me is that since I've installed 2 of these cameras a few days ago, my wireless signal has gone completely down twice and I needed to reboot my router to get it back. I'm not sure if (or how?) it's the cameras' fault yet but it has never done that before.* The pan and tilt feature work quite well. The motors are nice and quiet, although you can still hear them working.* The image quality is fairly good, again for the price. I had to adjust the focus on both of the cameras by turning the ring around the lens back and forth until it looked decent. You're not going to be able to make out people's faces from more than about 7-10ft away. Colors are acceptable.* I wanted to use one of the cameras to monitor my driveway and front porch by pointing it out a front window. This setup works fine in the daylight but once it gets dark, the IR LEDs automatically turn on and all I get is a bright reflection off of the glass. I haven't figured out a way to manually disable the IR yet, if that's possible. I may have to resort to electrical tape to cover them.* The cameras get a little warm to the touch after being plugged in a while. Nothing too bad but it would indicate to me that these probably won't last the longest. I may add some ventilation holes in the base to help. Writing this review got me curious so I just plugged it into my kill-a-watt and found that it uses about 2w of electricity, not too bad.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera.
Reviews.Author: Ethan Shepherd
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a replacement for one of a different brand that I couldn't get to work on my home network. This one worked right out of the box: just plugged it into my router where it was given an IP address, and then go to that address for the camera's interface. All the options are configured from there: remote access, alerts, etc., all pretty simple. Picture quality is pretty good (640x480), night vision works very well, haven't tried the audio. The 360 degree range means the one camera in my front window can view the whole front yard as well as pan around to the interior. Great camera for the price, I'll be getting another. Have to mention that the email support guy at Avacom was very helpful and knew what he was talking about, which was a nice surprise.

Reviews.Title: Avacom M1060W well worth the price
Reviews.Author: RAMON C BICKNELL
Reviews.Content: Received the new Avacom M1060W yesterday. Set it up the morning with no problems.  The picture quality is so much better than the Wansview NCB541W. A very affordable solution for a wireless IP camera that includes night vision..  I would recommend this Avacom M1060W  for anybody interested in a wireless IP camera. I would like to hear of any other Avacom products that you develop.  Thanks for everything.

Reviews.Title: Best IP Camera. Great quality. Awesome Support
Reviews.Author: Emad
Reviews.Content: With out a doubt, this item beats all other IP cameras on the market. Build quality is superb, video quality is perfect, and audio quality is great.This camera has all features you find in other models with a better price.Further, and this part is important, the manufacturer/seller is super fast and helpful with support. I emailed last night around 11 pm with a question regarding compatibility of this model with opensource ispy.  Within minutes I received a response telling me they will download ispy and get it to work.  This morning I received another email with exact instructions on set up.If you are torn between purchasing this model and a competitors, stop thinking about it and get this!

Reviews.Content: I GIVE THEM A 2 STARS BECAUSE IT DID NOT HAVE SATISFACTION WITH THE RESOLUTION OF THE CAMARA AND IS TOO SLOW TO MOVE

Reviews.Title: Good camera!!
Reviews.Author: Kirk Steinklauber
Reviews.Content: Nice camera and looks very similar to the Loftek CXS2200 but it was cheaper (thanks to the discount that I found in Amazon)The software to detect and configure the camera over the network using Ethernet cable connection didn't detected the camera but it detected my Loftek Camera.After fighting a bit with the configurations and doing a MAC Address scan I could access the web portal of the camera and configure it.The web interface and option menus is almost a replica of the Loftek one but it seems that has some minor enhancements (like be able to change the hostname).For a home camera works just fine and I have no issues besides the initial setup problems.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Camera and Customer Service
Reviews.Author: H. Stern
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to try to monitor what my dog does while I am not home or working upstairs at home. I had some problems getting my network to work with my cable router.  The customer service was amazing!  They helped me walk through every step of the process and answered any other questions I had.  They also were able to offer some suggestions on phone apps that I could get to control over my cell phone.  I had a problem with the microphone but, I think that is my wi-fi issues or because I have an older model cell phone.  First review ever on Amazon and had to share my experience.  Buy with confidence.

Reviews.Title: could not connect to iPhone 5C even after exchanging e-mail with tech service @avacomtech.com
Reviews.Author: Real Critique
Reviews.Content: I bought this product after reviewing total of 5 reviews, all of them 5 stars (I just noticed 2 of them are not verified buyers)!!!! Who are these reviewers? I finally had to return the product after trying to connect to it remotely from my iPhone 5C and failing it time after time (I was able to connect to it locally via the router.)  I read all the documents at avacomtech.com and followed the enclosed manual as much as I could (btw, terrible documentation and lack of directions with the or documentations @avacomtech.com.  did the manufacturer try following own manual before selling the product?). What good is the security camera if I am not able to check on it remotely?
